Name: Widow's Kiss
Ingredients: 45 ml Calvados / apple brandy / straight applejack
Instructions: STIR (or shake) all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.
Review: Herbal with hints of apple, mint and eucalyptus. This classic is also often made with green Chartreuse, but we prefer, as per classic recipes, with half Yellow Chartreuse and half Bénédictine.
History: Created by George J. Kappeler at New York City's Holland House Hotel. This recipe is adapted from his 1895 book Modern American Drinks .
Nutrition: One serving of Widow's Kiss contains 212 calories
